intro: Stachys lycopsiformis, commonly known as narrow-leaved betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces spikes of small, tubular blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Stachys lycopsiformis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has a long history of use in traditional herbal medicine.
